snippet: The public release of videotaped statements by a man who said he killed Etan Patz would poison a jury pool, a New York State judge ruled on Monday.
abstract: Justice Maxwell Wiley of State Supreme Court in Manhattan rules news organizations have no right to obtain copies of videotaped confessions made to police by Pedro Hernandez, man accused of killing Etan Patz; rules recordings, although introduced as evidence at pretrial hearing, would be likely to taint pool of potential jurors.
lead_paragraph: The public release of videotaped statements by a man who said he killed Etan Patz would poison a jury pool, a New York State judge ruled on Monday.

headline.main: Judge Denies News Media Copies of Videotapes in Patz Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Denies Press Copies of Videotapes in Patz Case
